page.description: Moves the focus up as if the user pressed the "Up" cursor key.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.UP() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.UP() Description The &ltOBJECT>.UP() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.UP() method moves the focus up as if the user had pressed the Up key. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example This script moves to the previous field on the form: parentform.up()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
